intro: Ceropegia melanantha, commonly known as the black-leaved ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pale green or yellow. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, clustered flowers, which are pollinated by specific insects. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
